Key Match Events: Pakistan bowled the inexperienced New Zealand side out for just 90 runs
Mohammed Rizwan scored an unbeaten 45 off just 34 balls to anchor the chase
New Zealand was sent in to bat with openers Tim Seifert and Tim Robinson out cheaply for 12 and 4 respectively
Pre-Game Insights: Black Caps captain Michael Bracewell said the Rawalpindi pitch was not an easy one to handle
One of the things we pride ourselves on as Black Caps is fighting right til the end
Post-Match Reflections: We didn't score quite enough runs,We were little bit slow to adapt to the surface and put ourselves under pressure there.
We did that tonight particularly with the bowling and in the field, we'll reflect on that tonight and move onto the next game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan has taken a 1-0 lead in the five match series
The series opener was abandoned due to rain
